basics.name: Doug Colaizzo
basics.label: Software Engineer  at Marathon Data Systems

work.summary: ☛ Architect and implement distributed message based platform applying SOA using NServiceBus and RavenDB for a SaaS Field Service Automation system.☛ Design Restful API using C# WebAPI. Develop HTML5 Single Page Application using AngularJS.☛ Lead discussions with Product Management and Engineering teams to apply DDD to actual customer business workflows.☛ Lead TDD (xUnit and SpecFlow),  and Agile Methodology processes to promote team best practices, code craftsmanship, and quality. ☛ Implement continuous deployment strategies using TeamCity, Octopus, and AWS.

Tutor students in SAT & ACT standardized tests, including grading essays and working with students to improve their scores. Worked as an SAT Proctor and facilitated test taking for large groups of students.
Developed exhibit analysis by recording consumer experience and escorting guests through exhibits. Helped design new exhibit for future floor showcase.

references.name: Michael Petretta
references.reference: Doug was my team project mentor for our undergraduate senior year capstone project at New Jersey Institute of Technology.  His engagement and ability to positively motivate others guided our team to success in placing 2nd overall at NJIT's 2013 Capstone Competition.

references.name: Eric Farr
references.reference:
Doug is one of the most creative developers I’ve ever worked with. He brings fresh ideas to every task he faces. His creative energy is infectious, and his sense of humor brings makes even the longest days in the teamroom fun.

Doug took the initiative to sponsor capstone projects at NJIT. He did an amazing job working with the students and creating a great reputation for the company within the school.

Any software team would be fortunate to have him, and I would relish the opportunity to work with Doug again.

volunteer.summary: Mentored NJIT students during their senior CS Capstone semester project. Organized design sessions, code reviews, and training. Lead 6 teams during 6 semesters, placing 1st or 2nd place in 4 of the 6 semester showcases.

awards.name: NJIT Division 1 Cross Country TOP 7
awards.description: Competed in Division 1 athletics and helped the team reach North East Regional.

projects.name: McHacks 2014: RescueMe
projects.description: A rescue quadcopter. Hackathon concept utilizing heart rate sensor to trigger GPS guided drone search and rescue.

projects.name: Plant Species Identification
projects.description: Application that identifies plant species from a picture and a game of 20 questions with the user.
